My life is in SHAMBLES. SHAMBLES I tell you!

Seriously. I really don't know quite how I turned so wrong and came to this, and I have know idea how to recover.

So. Vodka?

This morning I went to the grocery store. After I'd picked up a pineapple, it hit me that the grocery store was absurdly crowded for a Thursday morning and that I was in danger of being run over by a soccer mom with three shreiking children in her carriage. It was also way too hot. Claustrophobia set in and stuff started getting fuzzy, so I decided I was leaving and shoved my way into the express (10 items or FEWER, thankyou) line with the pineapple.

The approximately 15-year-old emo-coiffed cashier (stay in school, children) looked at my pineapple and said: 'That's it?'
'There are too many people here. I can't do this right now,' I replied.
'Well. I'm glad to see you have your priorites in order,' he informed me, and then proceeded to ring me up.

I'm still wondering what the hell he meant by that.

Laura's having a Patty's Day cocktail, and the pot of gold is totally going on my feet.

Now I'm just on the hunt for the most over-the-top dress possible. In my head it's kelly green (of course), strapless and has lots of ... tulle. Any ideas where I could buy it?

Yesterday I went shoe shopping for Sam's wedding. She had mentioned a pair she'd seen at Off Broadway that she thought we'd all like. I went to DSW, thinking, hey, same thing, and came up short. Upon calling her, I learned she doesn't actually care if we have matching shoes, just as long as they're 'platinum, strappy, and open toe.'

So I agonized for a while, texted photos to Rowan, and eventually decided on a sparkly little sandal with a 2-inch heel. 

Then I didn't follow through because I can't buy lame prom-ish shoes I really don't like, especially when I'm told I can get whatever I want within the guidelines. So, determined to find something 'platinum, strappy and open-toe that I might actually want to wear again some day post-wedding, I came home and did a little research.

Polling the readership:

Option A: HOT. But maybe too much? That is a 4.5-inch heel and it ain't MY wedding.

Or option B: CLASSIC. Functional and easy at 3 inches high. Actually hugely remeniscent of my infamous gold stilettos that I adore so much. Certainly filling the strappy requirement. Unfortunately, likely something I wouldn't be overly amped on wearing again unless all my other shoes in colors cooler than platinum were...in the dirty clothes pile?

Jennie and Jill voted B. Danne and my sister voted A. Jen will vote A, no need to wait til she gets back from TRINIDAD to ask her. I'm torn.

Keeping in mind the fact that our bridesmaid dresses are tea-length so our feet will absolutely be seen...ready, set, vote! (please?)

Someone please tell me what to do with my life. Quickly. I need to know by 5, actually.

I messed up last time I tried to figure it out for myself, so now I just want orders.

Kim: 'I HAVE NOTHING TO WEAR!' 
Jill: 'YOU HAVE MORE CLOTHES THAN ANYONE ELSE I'VE EVER KNOWN! And besides. Who are you trying to impress at work these days anyway?' 
Kim: 'Everyone. Always. Everyone.' 

10 min. later, twirling, strapless, empire-waist dress with ribbon, cardigan, heels, pearl earrings. 

Kim: 'What do you think? Too dressy?' 
Jill: 'Not if you're Elizabeth Taylor. Or live in New York.' 
Kim: 'Perfect.' 

I will not conform.

Okay, so...the black Mac costs $150 more than the white Mac.
There are no differences between the two besides color.
Discuss.

(Also, what am I doing? My laptop is barely a year old.)

I took a shower last night, which I usually never do because I am a morning shower person, particularly on weekdays (after I run at night, I don't wash my hair, I just rinse, because, you know, it's bad to over-wash your hair, or whatever). But last night, I thought it would be a good idea because I could sleep later.

And then when I woke up I was so confused that I got up to pee, got in the shower, and stood under the water for 5 minutes doing nothing until the water woke me up enough to reiterate the fact that I had to pee, and then I was all, 'why the fuck am I in the shower? Again?' But by then there was no turning back, mostly because the shower was hot and I was cold and did not want to get out.

So, I'm very clean. But going to be late. Oh well.

It also didn't help that I put the coffee in the coffee maker and turned it on...but never put in any water.

(took me less than a minute to figure that one out, but for a good few seconds it was dangerously nearing mental-breakdown mode as I thought my coffee maker had died)

Today's going to be good.

I'm pretty sure that the only people reading this on anything close to a regular basis are on my friends list, but I thought I'd formally announce that I'm going friends only, just in case. 

Because I write some really entertaining things and you know you want to read them ;)

So comment if you want to be added, and you will be. I just got over the whole having no idea who was reading up on my life thing and decided to lock entries.

Quote of the night:

Jennie: "Not to freak you out or anything, but my roommate has an AIM buddy icon of your boyfriend."

Ha! Hahahahahahahaha!

She can't have him, lalalalalalalala!

Yeah, looking at the stats and all it was probably the right thing to do, but, wow. This will take some getting used to.

"My initial reaction was, 'Wow,'" said Garciaparra. "I know there was a lot of talk and everything. A lot of speculation, but you don't know. I've been kind of away from it and really focused on just playing because it's stuff that's out of my control. And it's still out of my control. If it was in my control, I'd still be wearing a Red Sox uniform. That's the place I know, I love, all those fans, I'll always remember."

1)I can't figure out what's the strangest part: The fact that the girl I've called my best friend for the past 8 years is definitely not, or the fact that I'm pretty sure I couldn't care less about that realization. I just wonder what the hell was going through my head for so long.

2)Went out with Jennie and Cailin tonight and I love those girls more than life and want to take them with me to Manhattan. But I can't, and that's okay. And I was toasted (with all, count 'em, ALL of our FREE drinks at the bar) as 'the one about to be cooler than the rest of us put together' and I liked it, until Cai and I had a little chat by the harbor about Jennie and both walked away from it entirely confused...she's got everything going for her right now (we're talking some crazy-ass-good internship offer in D.C. and a just-drafted-by-the NHL boyfriend) and we're pretty sure she's about to throw it all away - except we're not sure if we're just THINKING she's throwing it all away, because she's about to go the path we, personally, wouldn't...argh...too hard...

3)Bobby asked me today if I think it would be stupid if we were to start dating (as in officially dating) now, and I said yes. And then he asked me if I thought it was stupid that we WEREN'T dating, and I also said yes. And then he asked me what we were supposed to do with that information, and I said 'nothing. Absolutely nothing.' And he said 'that's what I figured.' And that made me sad because I wanted to tell him how much I really like him, but I didn't because it seems so pointless. And we've known eachother for about 37 seconds, so it all seems extra stupid.

I didn't even strike out swinging tonight - totally looking at all three of those, and that's the worst way to go down. Ugh.

I almost forgot that tomorrow is going to be the best night EVER - free Dispatch farewell concert OUTSIDE in my favorite city in the world with my favorite friends in the world and the cutest hockey player ever ;) (see? SEE? Stupid sappy girl!)

And now I'm off to buy a footstool. Because in my new apartment in my other favorite city in the world, I'm not tall enough to reach the shelves or cabinet at the top of my closet. It's a tall person's apartment. 

I should probably also buy a fan...other favorite city in the world = at least 10 degrees hotter than favorite city in the world for the month of August...hot, yo.

Randomly tuned into Regis and Kelly this morning and had some Matt Damon with my coffee. I have never, EVER preferred Ben Affleck to him, I would just like to say. For no apparent reason.

Yeah, about that stool.

/End pointless post.

So, after much (apparently too much, I guess) buildup from pretty much everyone I know, I finally tried a famed Krispy Kreme doughnut, and well...
That was it?
I guess I'm just not a doughnut person. I mean, it was fresh and warm (which led me to wonder about people who buy like a dozen, because obviously they don't stay warm, and so then I can only imagine them tasting like any other glazed doughnut in a box, and in which case, what's the superiority other than they're smaller so you probably eat more of them?) and I guess that was nice, but...yeah. Doughnut. I just got a regular little glazed one - was I supposed to get one of the ones with sprinkles or chocolate or something?
I was kinda bummed cause I passed up ice cream in its favor. Oh well.
:(

So I thought my date the other night was fantastic (just realized I haven't written about it yet, but no time now...maybe later...in a nutshell: he holds doors and kisses extremely well and thinks I'm hilarious) but today totally beat it by about 67 times because he took off work and came down to see me! And then we went to Provincetown and went freaking whale watching and I jumped around like a little kid almost as much as he did and yelled and pointed at whales and on the ride back to the dock, while it was freezing and windy, I sat in his lap on the bow of the boat and we were obnoxiously adorable. And I went on a date and am currently all obnoxious girl wanting to listen to sappy love songs and design wedding dresses and write 'I <3 Bobby 4-Eva' on things.

I drunk-dialed Jill around 12:15 last night figuring she'd be driving home from work, but she was definitely still there and now my entire ex-newsroom knows I uttered the phrase "unemployment does wonders for your tan."
But, hey. It's true.
In between applying for jobs with Random House and ABC and a bunch of other places that will never call me back, occasionally showing up to cocktail on the Nantucket trips, and getting calls from places offering me what may or may not be telemarketing jobs with fancy names, I've had about 16 nervous breakdowns and begun just living in denial and having a Cape Cod vacation.
Yesterday: Went swimming and ate chicken salad-with-apples-and-grapes sandwiches all day, "cocktailed" (read: talked to Bobby for 2 hours because the first crossing was empty), went to Emily's cottage, watched some recaps of the Sox playing Little League...oh, I mean 'Major League Baseball,' got wasted, drunk-dialed, nervous breakdown-ed, recovered from nervous breakdown (thanks Rowan!), went to some other cottage, which was more like a palace on 6A, that belonged to some boys with an adorable chocolate lab named Bledsoe and a lot of illegal drugs, took VODKA shots (ouch...), went back to Em's, ate guacamole, passed out.
Today: Recovery via Gatorade and sun. Slept on the beach for a while. Bought salad, forgot to eat it, bought ice cream, remembered to eat that, came home, talked to Jen about how there is a clear and present danger of us becoming telemarketers with fancy names, then came online to lovely Howie Day icons (thanks again, Rowan :)! )
Tonight: Babysitting my cousin Kerry. We're seeing "A Cinderella Story", swimming in her pool, then getting ice cream (so...it's possible I'm about to go an entire day eating ONLY ice cream) and watching baseball highlights.
...And for some reason, despite all this, I'm still kinda wishing Random House would call...

So if that means editing documents in a law office is it for a while...well, it's closer to journalism than teaching sailing is, I suppose.
But I still want a newspaper job. Someone give me a job. Come on. I'm young and trainable and you can pay me shit!

Then we went to the mall, and because, even though I'm trying to convince myself that I'm not, I'm determined to show Brian that he's an idiotface and he's going to realize what he missed once I'm gone after this week...I bought a tiny skirt. And it's really tiny. With a ruffle. And then I bought the coolest shirt EVER. And then I bought a t-shirt at American Eagle for $4.86. And I'm going to be the hottest thing ever this week and then NOT say goodbye. Because I'm being a stubborn jealous brat and I don't care. The skirt is hot.

Then Jen's mom cooked us dinner, and then we went and got what was possibly the most amazing ice cream ever and I wanted to sneak into the Fisher Cats game, but it didn't really seem possible, but dammit I LOVE baseball. Last summer the goal (which was achieved) was 'get with a Cape league baseball player.' This summer? Jen's going for the Cats...I'll take the Nashua Pride. Mmm. Baseball players before they're millionaires and allowed to be out of shape and spit tobacco.

But speaking of millionaires...Sox game last night? Insanity. Absolute insanity. I love it. And I love that Barry Bonds is a fuckface. 

And if Johnny Damon and I ever got together...our kids would have the best skin tone and dimples EVER, thank you very much.

This is going nowhere at all, huh? Sorry.

This morning a man came to my door with a petition - one of those 'sign this so everyone in America can have a job! support John Kerry!' type deals - and he looks me over and it goes like this:

Him: "Hi. Are your parents home?"

Me: (picture thoroughly confused 8 a.m. state of mind) "Uh, no. They don't live here."

Him: (adopting confused look) "Oh. Well, is there a guardian or someone home?"

Me: "No...can I help you with something?"

Him: "I'm looking for signatures, but you need to be over 18."

Me: "..."

Him: "..."

Me: "I'm 22."

Him: "Oh. Really? I thought 16 or 17. Sorry."

16 or 17? Come on now. That's pushing it.

I swear life is funny every day. You know what's not cool? People who can't see that and appreciate it and have to be 'depressed' all the time. Because I'm all stressed and confused and maybe even sad right now (ew) and I still crack up laughing at least 37 times a day.

My mom made me run around buying stupid things like doilies and chafing dishes while Jen chased after me with a list, screening my phone calls and taking messages. Someone hire that girl as a personal assistant. The party eventually came and was good and I was drunk and got lots of money (not for being drunk...I can't write anymore, I've realized), and gorgeous Gabe came (just thought Kapler when I typed that, but no, gorgeous Gabe Kapler was not at my party, unfortunately) and so did Katie and her baby (ah!) and it was good to see them cause I hadn't in at least a year. My mom also developed a crush on my friend Tim, and that was weird. Big parties are difficult, I realized, because I was running around like an idiot trying to make sure I said something to everyone and I almost starved to death in the process. Finally I grabbed wine and ccake (I didn't know if I wanted my sister's or mine...so I took both...) and got on a boat and left for a while with select individuals on a covert 'escape-the-party' mission, and that was the best part.

Also: Saw my brother's band play and they are rockstars, Emily and I gave eachother identical tiny Coach clutches (except hers is black and mine is sea-blue) and laughed about that for a while, had a slumber party at other Emily's, got back drowned-rat graduation pictures and they're funny, drank at a Chinese restaurant dive with Cailin (holla, youngin), and bought a little green (sometimes more turquoise, sometimes more green) skirt at the Gap, which, by the way, has an excellent line and sales right now. I would like to point out that I was wearing it and Jill told me I was the cutest girl in the world on Tuesday, the night the world fell apart courtesy of a boy who doesn't even matter (funny how that happens). So I hope it's not ruined for me the next time I wear it.

I was attacked by a wild turkey yesterday. Seriously. I was just innocently running down the street in this pretty little town, when, upon passing by a patch of woods, I heard this suspicious commotion. I'm beginning to think I'm a very confrontational person when it comes to dangerous situations or something, because I totally stopped and walked closer and squinted into the trees. Then all these little field mice came scurrying out and ran across the street to the woods on the other side, and then I heard something bigger-sounding hiss or something and then go deeper into the woods, and then all of a sudden this PTERODACTYL struts out of the woods, stopping directly in front of me. Um, yeah. I think I stopped breathing. Have I ever talked about the time I was running in the woods and saw a bear? Cause this was about 197,000 times scarier somehow. The thing was HUGE, like as big as two chickens, and it was all puffed up like feathers standing out pissed-off and it had TALONS. So it starts to walk away and I'm standing there, NO CLUE what the hell I'm supposed to do, so I decide to attempt slow forward motion because, while I had somehow convinced myself I could outrun a bear, I didn't feel the same about the mutant turkey. One step and the thing turned around and totally...noise-made...at me! I don't know what to call it. It was a scary noise. I almost DIED. Then a car came, and the driver stopped at first, probably in awe of the thing, and then figured out what was going on and sped up to scare it and it went back past me and into the woods and I ran to the other side of the street and was then consoled by the little old man driver until I informed him that I would feel better if I could hurry up and run a million miles away. The thing ALMOST. ATE. ME. I would like to say that I now may have a rational fear of flightless birds. Give me a bear any day. In other news, Brian's voice now makes me die a little. He has the hottest voice EVER. God dammit. I think I managed to make him feel uncomfortable yesterday, which kicked ass until I remembered that when he gets nervous he looks like a little boy and makes me want to fix it. Hate. Him.

I swear I did not sit in a movie theatre last night and listen to a bunch of people breathe, "oh, Achilles! Got it." when the jerk gets shot in the foot.

Jesus.

 

Well, it was...good. Sometimes.

I would have preferred 'very loosely based' to 'inpsired by', personally. Not that I'm some huge Iliad purist (really, with the exception of Hector, I never really even remotely liked it - Greek myth doesn't do much for me) but it seems like the method was to take $200m or whatever, pull everything cool that ever happened in any Greek myth (hi! Trojan Horse!), give Brad Pitt a more golden tan than the statue of Apollo, and throw a few more pretty boys into skirts - insta-blockbuster!

Anyway...

Well, it was funny. Not sure if it was supposed to be funny, but I laughed every time someone pronounced "Menelaus" (who, by the way, I was pretty down with the idea of them killing. Didn't mind that, it worked.) Also, when Helen says, "Last night was a mistake"...HAHAHAHAHAHA! Okay, sorry. I wasn't the only one, though. Last night was a mistake? Ouch. Burn. Poor pretty-in-maybe-not-a-Helen-of-Troy-but-oh-well way actress. She's already playing an empty character, did she have to be ditzy as all that? Also when Paris says, "you think I'm a coward" and hotguy in front of me goes, "duh". Heh. That was good.

Paris. Paris was appropriately disgusting. I hated him as much as I felt I should, which is good, considering I've always though of him as one of the most hate-able characters in history. I wanted to slap him when he was on the ground clinging to Hector's leg. Shut up Paris. Good job on that one.

HECTOR! Yayayayayayayay! They didn't ruin Hector! I don't even know what to say. I love Hector. While we're at it, PRIAM! ODYSSEUS! Also yay.

Achilles was a big idiotface spoiled brat cocky bastard jerk. True to form, Achilles. Always hated Achilles almost as much as Paris. The fighting kicked ass. I was getting a little annoyed with the whole, "He has a heart! He doesn't have a heart! He has a heart! He doesn't have a heart but it's okay because he gives a cool speech about how he. Just. Is.! Oh, wait, he has a heart! He loves Briseis!" crap.

Hold up. Briseis. Hi, Briseis. Die. Hated her. Hated what they were trying to do with her character. If you wanted to make me believe Achilles wasn't a monster, well...okay, it wasn't going to work. But if you wanted me to believe in the humanity of his half-human side, the scene with Priam was great, and when he totally decked whats-his-face when he found out about Patroclus was very human. The crying over Hector's body pushed it. Anyway, back to Briseis. Ew. Also, she killed Agamemnon?! Come on, now. Like I said, not a purist, not a purist, really trying to swallow all the changes that come with being just "inspired by" but...hi? Clytemnestra? They really were banking on the assumption that most people haven't read this stuff and went to see the movie cause Orlando Bloom is in it. Which is probably actually the case, so on second thought, good assumption. But still.  Briseis can't kill Agamemnon! I'm putting my foot down on that one. I spent most of tonight thinking about Brian.

Don't puke. Or yell. Not how it sounds.

I was actually thinking, and I don't mean thinking about doing naughty things to him or making him my cute boyfriend or any of that...it kind of elevated to the point of thinking about people in general, and then life and then destiny and how it's all kind of a one-shot deal, the lot of it.

I want Brian to be in my life. And right now he only is kinda of...by default. And that sucks, because it doesn't matter, and so in 2 months the way it will most likely be will be that we don't speak and will never see eachother again.

And I like him. And by like him, I'm not talking want him. I like his personality, I like who he seems to be, I like the same things he likes, and just looking at that stupidly generic list seems like cause enough for me to want him to be my friend. Which I do. But...so? Now what?

See, so that got me going, and I started thinking about all the times in  life where you meet people and it's one of those instances where you're just like, 'wow', for a second and all alive and it's perfect and you're so happy to have met this person, because really, it's people that make your life, and then...they're gone. How many times do people just let other amazing people walk out of their lives?

And how much are they supposed to do about it?

I guess I believe in fate to a certain extent. I do believe that everything happens for a reason, if only because I always want some justification for everything. So I don't believe that we control our own destiny; however, I do believe that we control our lives, meaning those day-to-day things we're living or pretending to live every time we wake up. Maybe in the end we have no say, but if we go through every day just waiting for life to happen, isn't that more existing than actually living?

Because that's my biggest fear in the world, existing rather than living. Bigger than the failure one.

Life's not fair, though, of course, so even though I can sit here and be all matter-of-fact and 'I want him in my life,' I can't just put him there. I can't make him want the same thing, and I can't ask him if he does because that's scary. But does he? Yeah, I'd never know unless I asked, because who talks about these things?

And does it even make sense?

I really hate the idea of all life being is a big hunt for people you want to fuck. I hate the idea that making friends is impossible and having sex is all there is, so it's like...fuck and one day maybe you'll fall in love with one of them, or you're pretty much screwed.

Why can't we just hang out and have fun like we did when we first met? Oh, right. Because that was like...courtship, or something ridiculous. Hanging out to get to the kissing, and now it's over.

And why am I so caught up on him about this anyway? Really, would I have even bothered getting to know him enough to care about this if I hadn't been attracted to him in the first place? How come I'm not hell-bent on keeping in my life and getting to know that guy whose name I forget who always holds the door for me? For all I know he could be amazing. See, this is disgusting.

But we could sail, and watch the Red Sox, and laugh and all that crap we used to do, and...I don't know. I want to know him. Not 'know him-oh-im-so-emo-no-one-gets-me' crap. I just mean...I don't even know what I mean. I certainly can't write it very coherently.

But I want him here. And he's not going to be, and I'm not going to do anything about it, and so I'm existing.

So says the 23-year-old to the 22-year-old.

I know it's about learning. And I know that when anyone who isn't a page designer picks up the newspaper this morning, he or she isn't going to notice a single one of the things that I know were wrong with my pages. I said that, and Andrew looked at me like I was crazy and asked if I really thought anyone minded helping eachother out, and for some reason I was suddenly ready to cry!
